Entry.JapaneseText: [VARIABLE]
Entry.EnglishText: [VARIABLE]

Entry.JapaneseText: 男の人
Entry.EnglishText: Man

Entry.JapaneseText: 女の人
Entry.EnglishText: Woman

Entry.JapaneseText: select
Entry.EnglishText: Select

Entry.JapaneseText: notice
Entry.EnglishText: Notice

Entry.JapaneseText: <Veigue>
Entry.EnglishText: <Veigue>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Mao>
Entry.EnglishText: <Mao>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Eugene>
Entry.EnglishText: <Eugene>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Annie>
Entry.EnglishText: <Annie>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Tytree>
Entry.EnglishText: <Tytree>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Hilda>
Entry.EnglishText: <Hilda>

Entry.JapaneseText: ハック
Entry.EnglishText: Hack

Entry.JapaneseText: 見張りの男
Entry.EnglishText: Watchman

Entry.JapaneseText: 民家
Entry.EnglishText: Residence

Entry.JapaneseText: ピピスタ
Entry.EnglishText: Pipista

Entry.JapaneseText: ピピスタ・民家
Entry.EnglishText: Pipista - Residence

Entry.JapaneseText: この音、かなり近いよな。 一体、何が起きてるんだ!?
Entry.EnglishText: That sound came from nearby. What in the world is going on!?

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマにかまってるほど、 ヒマじゃないんだよ！
Entry.EnglishText: I don't have time to be bothered by any Huma!

Entry.JapaneseText: この音……まったく、 次から次へと色々起こるな……
Entry.EnglishText: That sound... Good grief, it's just one thing after another.

Entry.JapaneseText: この村では、今、三つの階級がある。 上から、<Red>特等民<White>、<Red>優良民<White>、<Red>二級民<White>だ。
Entry.EnglishText: In this village, there are three social classes. At the top, we have the <Red>Superior Citizens<White>, followed by the <Red>Greater Citizens<White>, and at the bottom the <Red>Lesser Citizens<White>.

Entry.JapaneseText: あんたは<Red>二級民<White>だから、 <Red>優良民<White>の俺には 逆らっちゃいけないんだぜ。 よく覚えとくがいい。
Entry.EnglishText: Since you're a <Red>Lesser Citizen<White>, you have to obey me, a <Red>Superior Citizen<White>. Remember this.

Entry.JapaneseText: もちろんヒューマはそれ以下の <Red>劣等民<White>だがな。
Entry.EnglishText: Of course, Huma are even lower on the class system and are considered <Red>Inferior Citizens<White>.

Entry.JapaneseText: 劣等民が、俺に気安く声を かけるんじゃない！
Entry.EnglishText: Don't you inferior folks dare speak with me!

Entry.JapaneseText: 子供がいなくなったのは、 <Red>二級民<White>のせいだぜ!?
Entry.EnglishText: It's all because of those <Red>Lesser Citizens<White> that the kids have disappeared!

Entry.JapaneseText: それなのに、俺たちの責任にされて、 そのせいで、格下げになったら たまったもんじゃねえ！
Entry.EnglishText: But if they blame us and we get demoted to a lower class, I'm gonna be pissed!
Entry.Notes: It's a duplicate of another line, but this may need to change since it seems like this one is standalone (remove the but)

Entry.JapaneseText: ああ……イライラする…… ヒューマは……出ていけッ!!
Entry.EnglishText: Grrr... How irritating... Get out, you - you Huma!!

Entry.JapaneseText: うちの子があんな風に 思ってたなんて……
Entry.EnglishText: I can't believe my daughter would think like that...

Entry.JapaneseText: 劣等民……いや…… ヒューマと話す気分には なれない……
Entry.EnglishText: You Inferior Citizen... No... I don't want to talk with you Huma right now...

Entry.JapaneseText: あのガキは二級民なんだぞ…… <Red>毛むくじゃら<White>の何がいいというんだ？
Entry.EnglishText: That brat's just some Lesser Citizen... What's so good about being a <Red>furry<White>?
Entry.Notes: Second sentence may need a revision depending on context.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……何も話したくない。
Entry.EnglishText: ...I don't want to talk.

Entry.JapaneseText: 娘なら外で遊んでるよ。 あの二級……
Entry.EnglishText: My daughter is playing outside. She's with that <Red>Lesser Citizen<White>...

Entry.JapaneseText: ……トッポと一緒だ。
Entry.EnglishText: ...with Topp.

Entry.JapaneseText: うちの娘は一体、どこを ほっつき歩いてるんだか……
Entry.EnglishText: I have no idea where my daughter could be wandering...

Entry.JapaneseText: 夕食のミートソースが 思いのほか上手にできたの。 ちょっと味見してってよ。
Entry.EnglishText: The meat sauce I made for dinner came out better than expected. Why don't you take a bite?
Entry.Notes: Not sure if there's a specific name for the recipe/food in this line.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140>食べますか？ はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Take a bite? Yes No

Entry.JapaneseText: <Green>『<item:2000000C>』を食べました。
Entry.EnglishText: <Green>Ate "<item:2000000C>."

Entry.JapaneseText: うまい……
Entry.EnglishText: It's good...

Entry.JapaneseText: おいしい!! おいしいヨ!!
Entry.EnglishText: This is so good!! It's so dang tasty!!

Entry.JapaneseText: これはうまいな……
Entry.EnglishText: This is delicious...

Entry.JapaneseText: おいしいですね♪
うめえぜ！ こいつぁ、五つ星だ！
おいしいわね……
Entry.EnglishText: This tastes delicious...

Entry.JapaneseText: <Green>『<item:2000000C>』のレシピを入手しました。
Entry.EnglishText: <Green>Obtained recipe for "<item:2000000C>"!

Entry.JapaneseText: [VARIABLE]
Entry.EnglishText: [VARIABLE]
Entry.Notes: DON'T EDIT THIS, IT'S A DUMMY ENTRY

Entry.JapaneseText: 何よ！ おいしいわよ！ 私の料理の腕は確かよ！
Entry.EnglishText: Good to hear! I'm glad it tastes good. I sure am one fine cook!

Entry.JapaneseText: すごく揺れてる……！
Entry.EnglishText: We're shaking so much!

Entry.JapaneseText: どんな地震があっても、ここは 昔から一度も崩れた事がないって 言われてるけど……心配だわ！
Entry.EnglishText: We've been told that this place has stayed in tact no matter the earthquake, but I'm still worried!

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマなんかと、 しゃべってる場合じゃないのよ！
Entry.EnglishText: This is no time to be talking to a Huma!

Entry.JapaneseText: <Red>毛むくじゃら<White>のくせに、 えらそうな<Red>二級民<White>の女が いるのよね。
Entry.EnglishText: That <Red>furball<White> has quite the nerve despite only being a <Red>Lesser Citizen<White>.

Entry.JapaneseText: ドバル様、なんとか こらしめてくれないかしら……
Entry.EnglishText: Chief Doval, please deal with that weasel.
Entry.Notes: Literally, she's asking Doval to stop that Lesser citizen woman

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマは出てって……！
Entry.EnglishText: Get out you Huma!

Entry.JapaneseText: うちの娘が帰ってこないのを 旦那が探しに行ったんだけど 帰ってこないの……
Entry.EnglishText: Our daughter didn't come back home, so my husband went out to look for her, but she's still not back yet...

Entry.JapaneseText: ミイラ取りが…… ミイラ……？
ちょっと……！ 出てってよ！
Entry.EnglishText: Hey! Get out of my house!

Entry.JapaneseText: <Red>毛むくじゃら<White>のせいで……！
Entry.EnglishText: It's all because of that <Red>damned furry<White>...!

Entry.JapaneseText: レイ…… 無事でいて……
Entry.EnglishText: Rei... Please be safe...

Entry.JapaneseText: あんたたちに 同情してほしくないわ……！
Entry.EnglishText: I don't need you guys to feel sorry for me...!

Entry.JapaneseText: ああ……帰ってきたのね…… よかった……
Entry.EnglishText: Ahh... You're back... Thank goodness...

Entry.JapaneseText: 酋長の家の前で、 父親が待ってます。
Entry.EnglishText: Your father is waiting for you in front of the Chief's house.

Entry.JapaneseText: 早く顔を見せて、 安心させてやってください。
Entry.EnglishText: Hurry and show your face to your father so he won't worry any longer.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……ありがとう……
Entry.EnglishText: ...Thank you...

Entry.JapaneseText: 娘があんな事を言うなんて…… 私は間違っていたのかしら……
Entry.EnglishText: I can't believe my daughter would say something like that... Was I perhaps mistaken in my actions?

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマと話す気分じゃないわ。
Entry.EnglishText: I'm not in the mood to speak with any Huma.

Entry.JapaneseText: 羽があってもなくても 同じガジュマ……
Entry.EnglishText: Even with or without wings, we're all still Gajuma...

Entry.JapaneseText: じゃあ、私たちと ヒューマの違いって何？
Entry.EnglishText: So what exactly marks the differences between the Huma and us?

Entry.JapaneseText: ああ……考え続けたら 夜も眠れない……
Entry.EnglishText: Ugh... At this rate, I won't be able to fall asleep if I keep thiking about it...

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマ……とは 無駄な話はしてられないわ……
Entry.EnglishText: A Huma... I'm not going to waste my time speaking with you.

Entry.JapaneseText: うちの娘を見てて 思い出したわ……
Entry.EnglishText: Watching my daughter, I'm reminded of my past.

Entry.JapaneseText: 子供の頃、 旅のヒューマに色んな話を 聞かせてもらった事……
Entry.EnglishText: When I was a child, I used to listen to various stories from traveling Huma.

Entry.JapaneseText: なんだか切ない気分に なっちゃった……
Entry.EnglishText: I'm feeling somewhat burdened right now...

Entry.JapaneseText: 以前はこの村には、 問題なんてなかったのに……
Entry.EnglishText: In the past, there used to be no problems in our village...

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマと話す気分じゃないわ。
Entry.EnglishText: I'm not in the mood to speak with any Huma.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……キミたち！ 来てくれたんだね！ 助かったぁ……
Entry.EnglishText: ...It's you guys! You came for me! Oh, thank goodness...

Entry.JapaneseText: 残念だが、まだここから 出る事はできない。
Entry.EnglishText: Sorry, but we can't actually get you out of here just yet.

Entry.JapaneseText: えっ……？
Entry.EnglishText: Wha...?

Entry.JapaneseText: キミが<Cyan>聖壇<White>を傷つけたり、 冒とくしたんじゃないってコトを 証明しなくちゃならないんだヨ。
Entry.EnglishText: We have to prove that you weren't trying to desecrate or deface the <Cyan>altar<White> first.

Entry.JapaneseText: 傷つけるだなんて……！ 僕は悪い事はしてない！ ウソだったら、バルカまで 泳いで帰ったっていいよ！
Entry.EnglishText: Why on earth would I do that?! I had no ill intention at all! If I'm lying, I'll swim all the way back to Balka!

Entry.JapaneseText: だったら、どうして<Cyan>聖壇<White>の部屋に 忍び込んだりしたんだ？
Entry.EnglishText: Okay, but then why did you sneak into the <Cyan>altar<White> room in the first place?

Entry.JapaneseText: ……仕方がなかったんだよ。 ドバル酋長とは何度も手紙を やりとりして、<Cyan>聖壇<White>を調べる 許可をもらっていたのに……
Entry.EnglishText: ...Because I had to. I exchanged countless letters with Chief Doval to see if I could get permission to investigate the <Cyan>altar<White>, and eventually he allowed it.

Entry.JapaneseText: やっとの事でここまで来てみたら、 酋長は人が変わったみたいになっていて、 僕がヒューマっていうだけで、 話すら聞いてくれなかった……だから……
Entry.EnglishText: But when I finally got here, it was like he was an entirely different person. He wouldn't even talk to me because I was a Huma, so...

Entry.JapaneseText: <Blue>思念<White>の影響かな……？
Entry.EnglishText: Probably because of the <Blue>Will<White>?

Entry.JapaneseText: おそらくな……
Entry.EnglishText: Most likely.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……そうまでして、ハックさんが 調べたかった事って何なんですか？
Entry.EnglishText: What on earth are you wanting to investigate so badly?

Entry.JapaneseText: ……<Yellow>聖なる鳥<White>を よみがえらせようとしていたんだ……
Entry.EnglishText: ...I was attempting to revive the <Yellow>Sacred Bird<White>.

Entry.JapaneseText: <Yellow>聖なる鳥<White>……！
Entry.EnglishText: The <Yellow>Sacred Bird<White>...!

Entry.JapaneseText: メセチナ洞窟と関連して、 古い文献を読んでいたら、 ピピスタの事が書かれていたんだ。
Entry.EnglishText: When I was reading the ancient texts relating to the Mesechina Caverns, I also found some writings concerning Pipista.

Entry.JapaneseText: その文献によれば、 <Cyan>聖壇<White>に火を灯せば <Yellow>聖なる鳥<White>がよみがえるって……
Entry.EnglishText: According to the texts, if you set fire to the <Cyan>altar<White>, the <Yellow>Sacred Bird<White> will be revived.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……ピピスタに来て 正解だったみたいね。
Entry.EnglishText: Looks like coming to Pipista was the right decision.

Entry.JapaneseText: うん！ イーフォンの言葉と 何か関係ありそうだネ！
Entry.EnglishText: Yep! There's probably some connection between this and the message we got from Eephon!

Entry.JapaneseText: えっ、キミたちも <Yellow>聖なる鳥<White>の事を 調べているのかい？
Entry.EnglishText: Oh, you're here to investigate the <Yellow>Sacred Bird<White> as well?

Entry.JapaneseText: ああ……そのようなものだ。
Entry.EnglishText: Yeah, something like that.

Entry.JapaneseText: それで、<Cyan>聖壇<White>に火を点けて、 <Yellow>聖なる鳥<White>はよみがえったんですか？
Entry.EnglishText: So, did lighting the <Cyan>altar<White> revive the <Yellow>Sacred Bird<White>?

Entry.JapaneseText: それが……何も起こらなかった…… だけど、その文献は由緒あるものだし、 きっと何かがあるはずなんだ……
Entry.EnglishText: Well... No, nothing happened. But those texts are historical artifacts, so there has to be some truth to them...

Entry.JapaneseText: <Yellow>聖なる鳥<White>をよみがえらせると 何かが起こる……それが聖獣と 関係するなら、<Yellow>聖なる鳥<White>の事を もう少し調べてみるしかないな。
Entry.EnglishText: If the <Yellow>Sacred Bird<White> is revived, then something is bound to happen... Assuming that it's connected to the Sacred Beasts, we'll need to look into this further.

Entry.JapaneseText: 私たちのためにも、 ハックのためにもね。
Entry.EnglishText: For our sake, and Hack's as well.

Entry.JapaneseText: 村の人たちに 話を聞いてみようヨ。
Entry.EnglishText: Let's go talk to the villagers.

Entry.JapaneseText: 「<Cyan>聖壇<White>に、<Yellow>命の珠<White>の赤く燃ゆる時、 <Yellow>聖なる鳥<White>は羽ばたかん」か。 <Cyan>聖壇<White>に火を灯すだけじゃダメなんだ、 きっと、<Yellow>命の珠<White>が必要なんだろうな。
Entry.EnglishText: "When the <Yellow>Jewel of Life<White> glows red atop the <Cyan>sacred altar<White>, the <Yellow>Sacred Bird<White> shall spread her wings once more." It's not enough to just light the <Cyan>sacred altar<White>, we also the <Yellow>Jewel of Life<White>.

Entry.JapaneseText: おそらく、あの<Cyan>聖壇<White>に何かを捧げて、 火を灯すって事じゃないかな？ 捧げる物が何かわかれば、 きっとうまくいくよ。
Entry.EnglishText: Perhaps we need to offer something on the <Cyan>sacred altar<White> and light it on fire? If we know what the offering is, I'm sure it'll work.

Entry.JapaneseText: こういう言い伝えに出てくる物は、 その土地に深く関わりがある場合が 多いんだけど……
Entry.EnglishText: The objects in such legends are often deeply connected to the land where they originated...

Entry.JapaneseText: ハック、迎えに来たヨ！
Entry.EnglishText: Hack, we've come to free you!

Entry.JapaneseText: で、出られるのかい？ じゃあ、<Yellow>聖なる鳥<White>は、 よみがえったの!?
Entry.EnglishText: ...You mean I'm free to go? Does that mean you revived the <Yellow>Sacred Bird<White>?

Entry.JapaneseText: うー、僕も見たかったなあ！
Entry.EnglishText: Man, I can't believe I missed it!

Entry.JapaneseText: ドバル酋長から、 <Cyan>聖壇<White>の調査の許可ももらった。 自由に調べていいそうだ。
Entry.EnglishText: Chief Doval has granted you permission to study the <Cyan>sacred altar<White>. You're free to examine it to your heart's content.

Entry.JapaneseText: ほ、本当に!? 信じられない！ みなさん、本当にありがとう！
Entry.EnglishText: S-Seriously?! No way! You guys are the best!

Entry.JapaneseText: じゃあ、僕は早速、<Cyan>聖壇<White>を 調べに行って来る！
Entry.EnglishText: There's no time to waste, I've gotta start my research!

Entry.JapaneseText: オレたちも行こう。
Entry.EnglishText: We should join him.

Entry.JapaneseText: <Cyan>聖壇<White>に火を灯せば<Yellow>聖なる鳥<White>が よみがえるって文献には書いてあるよ。
Entry.EnglishText: According to the texts, if you set fire to the <Cyan>altar<White>, the <Yellow>Sacred Bird<White> will be revived.

Entry.JapaneseText: 手がかりはきっとこの村にある。 みんな、がんばって……！
Entry.EnglishText: The key to solving this must be in the village somewhere. Good luck you all!

Entry.JapaneseText: なに？ 酋長の許可をもらった？ ううん……それなら…… 仕方がないが……
Entry.EnglishText: What? The Chief gave you permission? Well, I guess I have no choice, then...

Entry.JapaneseText: だが、酋長の信頼を 裏切るような事があれば、 我らはおまえたちを許さんぞ。
Entry.EnglishText: But remember this: if you betray the trust of our Chief, we will not forgive you.

Entry.JapaneseText: ああ、わかった。
Entry.EnglishText: Yes, I understand.

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマの誇りがあるのなら ヒューマなどとつるむのは やめるべきだ。
Entry.EnglishText: If you have any pride as a Gajuma, you should stop associating yourself with any Huma.

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマの言う事は 聞く耳持たん……
Entry.EnglishText: I refuse to listen to anything a Huma has to say.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140>休憩しますか？ はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Would you like to rest? Yes No

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『のこの像』 ナゾの生物の像。 のこのきのこと呼ばれる耳、 ビタミンと食物繊維が豊富で、 とても美味。 これは木でできているので食べられない。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Noko Statue - A statue of a mysterious creature. Their ears that are called mushrooms are full of vitamins and dietary fiber and are delicious. This statue is made out of wood and is indedible.

Entry.JapaneseText: ねえ、のこ、 ボクの悩み事聞いてくれる？
かわいい……？
……自分の事、かわいいと 思ってる目ね……
<speed:0>『のこの像』 こちらを何か言いたそうに じっと見つめている。
閉めておこう……
……なんて、人形に言ってもネ！ 今度、<Eugene>に相談しようっと。
わたし、この手のものは もう卒業しなくちゃ……
閉めよう……
その目…… やめろよな……
<speed:0>『厚いカーテン』 カーテンがピタリと 閉じている。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Thick Curtains - These curtains are shut tight.

Entry.JapaneseText: 勝手に開けない方がいい……
開けちゃいけないよネ？
勝手に開けるべきではないな。
勝手に開けちゃ、 マズイですよね……
開けるのはやめとこうぜ。
開けるのは やめておきましょう……
